An Introduction to Proteomic and Transcriptomics Data Analysis

This tutorial is intended to get students started using commonly used tools and approaches for proteomics and transcriptomics data analysis. The techniques covered include raw data processing (e.g. using search engines to identify peptides and proteins in mass-spectrometry data) and file formats, statistical analysis (identifying which genes or proteins are differentially expressed) and biological interpretation (e.g. finding those pathways or biological processes that are represented in a set of proteomics or transcriptomics data).

Getting Started

Use the navigation bar at the top of each page to move through the tutorial. Read the guides on proteomics and transcriptomic data analysis first, and then choose one of the case studies to get started
